'''Harfalas''' was the southern half of the region of [[Falas]], located southeast of [[Eglamar (Falas)|Eglamar]], and northwest of [[Arvernien]].<ref name=Har/><ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, "South-western section", §64, p. 190</ref>

The region of Harfalas was marked on ''[[the Second 'Silmarillion' Map]]'',<ref name=Har>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, ''Sheet 3 South-west'', p. 184</ref> which formed the basis for the [[Map of Beleriand and the Lands to the North|map of Beleriand]] in the published ''[[Silmarillion]]''.<ref>{{LR|A3}}, pp. 407-413</ref>

However, apart from being labeled on the aforementioned map, Harfalas was never mentioned again, nor did it appear in any of the narratives, annals or essays set in the [[First Age]].<ref>{{WJ|Beleriand}}, "North-western section", §21, pp. 186-7</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Harfalas'' is in [[Sindarin]], meaning "South [[Falas]]". It is a combination of the prefixal form ''[[harn|har-]]'' ("south") + ''[[Falas#Etymology|falas]]'' ("shore").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1729730805.html|articlename=S. ''Harfalas'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=24 November 2023}}</ref>
